pullrequest.title: Replace friction of hinged_door with a spring

content.raw:
After a cursory investigation, I found that ADA standards dictate a 5lb force limit for operating a door. That refers to the amount of force required to push a door open. I couldn't find anything explicit about the maximum force for turning a handle specifically, but 1/5 of the overall force seems reasonable.

This does mean that the stiction of the door hinge is violating ADA regulations by ~30%. However, we may want to keep it like that, because otherwise it might swing open as soon as a robot bumps into the door or the door handle, and that would make it difficult to test grasping.

I did reduce the damping coefficient in b5bd83d because it was being awfully slow in returning to its home position.
